alert.note: Alert for Manatee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 30 at 9:27PM EDT until September 01 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Manatee River Near Myakka Head at SR 64 affecting Manatee County. .Heavy rainfall during the past 24 hours will cause minor flooding on the Manatee river at Myakka Head. For the Manatee...including Myakka Head at SR 64, Rye Bridge...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Manatee River near Myakka Head at SR 64. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Private road and bridge 1 mile downstream flood. Agricultural, rural Kibler area begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 11.6 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.6 feet on 08/24/1985. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Mon Manatee River Myakka Head at SR 11.0 8.8 Wed 8 pm 11.6 9.8 9.1 7.2 6.2 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued noon Thursday.Thursday afternoon at 1230 PM EDT.
